result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ted Forrest Robertson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Ted Forrest Robertson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Ted Forrest Robertson.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire & Waiver

Defendant Ted Forrest Robertson in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, received and filed

Defendant Ted Forrest Robertson in court, appear by video.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Commissioner Roth ordered the cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Antionette T.B.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Ted Forrest Robertson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Actual Date Bond Posted with the Sheriffs Department:
